Comment: Arizona is not really a cesspit state though... most of AZ laws are very libertarian/conservative leaning (maximum gun rights, low taxes, pro-parent and school choice, business-friendly, etc.) because she was preceded by a long line of Republican governors who typically enacted reasonable policies. She has not been able to really liberalize or walk back the GOP agenda that is in place because she has no control of the state congress, which currently both chambers are controlled by republicans as they have been for a long time. All she is doing is stone-walling the republican congress from getting anything done like passing an election integrity bill. She is a completely useless obstructionist who needs to be shown the door, but I wouldn't conflate her own shortcomings as governor with Arizona's shortcomings. Most of the current state laws and policies are conservative and are the opposite of what Katie Hobbs wants for the state. She would turn it into California lite if congress let her.

Comment: Massive scandal the media completely swept under the rug.  Even if there was no hanky panky and it was all coincidental, the idea that she oversaw her own election without recusing herself is insane.  [Calls Grow for Katie Hobbs to Not Oversee Arizona Election | TIMECalls Grow for Katie Hobbs to Not Oversee Arizona Election | TIME](https://time.com/6227705/katie-hobbs-role-election-chief-arizona-governors-race/)  Here is Reuters running cover on the Heat Maps:  [Fact Check: Heat map showing Republican voters in Maricopa County does not prove that voter fraud was committed during the midterm elections | Reuters](https://www.reuters.com/article/fact-check/heat-map-showing-republican-voters-in-maricopa-county-does-not-prove-that-voter-idUSL1N33A1TR/)  Here is NBC running cover on the printer/scanner problems...problems that only developed in heavy republican areas.....as shown on the heat maps the elections office had on their walls, the same election office Hobbs over saw.  [Printer problems in Arizona election traced to changes in ballot paper](https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/2022-election/printer-problems-arizona-election-traced-changes-ballot-paper-rcna79062)  Is it possibly a coincidence?  Sure.  But being the both houses are majority Republican really makes one wonder.  Had she recused herself when she announced her campaign, then the perception of conspiracy would be greatly diminished.  But she is a Democrat....it's \[D\]ifferent for them.
